content.question: All of the following statements about the Hutu and Tutsi ethnic groups in Rwanda are factually accurate. Which would best explain how the attitudes expressed in the “Hutu Ten Commandments” were a reaction to past developments in Rwandan history?

choices.label: Traditional Tutsi society was based on pastoralism and animal husbandry, while traditional Hutu society was based on agriculture.
The Tutsi were heavily favored and promoted to positions of power under European colonial rule, while the Hutu were not.
Historically, the Tutsi and Hutu ethnic groups spoke different dialects of the same language.
Hutu and Tutsi were not the only ethnic groups in Rwanda but coexisted with a third ethnic group, the Twa.

content.answer: The Tutsi were heavily favored and promoted to positions of power under European colonial rule, while the Hutu were not.

skill.text: Skill 5.B: Explain how a historical development or process relates to another historical development or process.
